results.title: Westworld
results.creator_credit: Michael Crichton, Paul N Lazarus III and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Set in the not too distant future, this is a vision of what may occur if man becomes too reliant on the infallibility of machines.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Crichton, Paul N Lazarus III and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.description: Westworld combines solid entertainment and chilling topicality with a futuristic, suspenseful plot written by Michael Chrichton. Set in the not too distant future, this is a vision of what may occur if man becomes too reliant on the infallibility of machines. Westworld is one of three giant theme parks built in what is left of America’s great outdoors where for $1,000 a day, tourists may indulge their highest and lowest appetites. Richard Benjamin and James Brolin are among the visitors to the futuristic theme park where the gun-hands and dance-hall girls are robots programmed to serve the guest’s whims and fantasises until something malfunctions in their circuitry. Yul Brynner delivers a remarkably eerie performance as a robot cowboy who develops a taste for the kill.
description_for_label: Westworld combines solid entertainment and chilling topicality with a futuristic, suspenseful plot written by Michael Chrichton. Set in the not too distant future, this is a vision of what may occur if man becomes too reliant on the infallibility of machines. results.title: Puberty Blues
results.creator_credit: Bruce Beresford, Margaret Kelly, Joan Long and Limelight Productions
results.brief_description: A popular coming-of-age story set on Cronulla Beach, where two high school girls, Debbie and Sue, have to navigate the chauvinism and sexism of the popular Greenhills surf gang to find their own selves.

constellations_other.name: Great southern land?
constellations_other.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Bruce Beresford, Margaret Kelly, Joan Long and Limelight Productions
results.description: Unusually, the focus here is on the sexual and social rites of passage of two teenage girls in a male-dominated world. Debbie and Sue are accepted into the Greenhills’ gang, an elite group occupying a particular stretch of Cronulla beach. As surfie groupies Debbie and Sue are required to submit to male whims. Although the girls are proposed as subjects the film maintains a humorously ironic distance from the awfulness of the scene, particularly through the use of narration. The boys, collectively dominant, are individually consigned to the margins. Debbie and Sue are the real mates who ultimately break out of the confines of male-imposed rules. Cast includes: Nell Schofield, Jad Capelja, Geoff Rhoe, Tony Hughes. Based on the book by Cathy Lette and Gabrielle Carey.
description_for_label: Unusually, the focus here is on the sexual and social rites of passage of two teenage girls in a male-dominated world. results.title: Walking on Water
results.creator_credit: Tony Ayres, Liz Watts and SBS Independent
results.brief_description: An impressive Australian debut feature from Tony Ayres about a young man’s death and the aftermath for his friends and family.

constellations_other.name: Tony Ayres
constellations_other.description: Charts the acclaimed career of Tony Ayres through his work in film and TV.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Ayres, Liz Watts and SBS Independent
results.description: Impressive Australian debut feature from Tony Ayres about a young man’s death and the aftermath for his friends and family. Gavin is a gay man living in Sydney when he succumbs to illness; his two best friends, Anna and Charlie, who assist his death in its final stages, grieve inconsolably, blocking their pain and memories with drugs, alcohol and sex. Whilst Charlie’s relationship with his boyfriend sours, Anna embarks on an affair, whilst shifting into controlling over-drive. This puts her in conflict with Gavin’s mother, who finds her role usurped. Despite the morbid subject matter “Walking on water” relishes in gallows humour, showing that even in death, there is life. Brilliant central performances from Vince Colosimo and Maria Theodorakis, coupled with intelligent scripting make this a memorable experience.
description_for_label: Impressive Australian debut feature from Tony Ayres about a young man’s death and the aftermath for his friends and family. results.title: Star Wars Battlefront
results.brief_description: Star Wars: Battelfront allows players to blast or lightsabre their way through some of the most iconic battles from the Star Wars universe.

constellations_other.name: Action, emotion and videogames
constellations_other.description: More and more, videogames are beginning to favour emotion as much as action, just like their film and TV cousins.

results.description:
In 2004, the original Star Wars: Battlefront came onto the scene and took gamers – and Star Wars fans – by surprise. It was an ambitious action shooter that gave players the opportunity to step into the shoes of their favorite Star Wars characters, pilot quintessential Star Wars vehicles, and relive classic Star Wars battles.

Fast forward nearly 10 years and gamers still have many of those same Star Wars gaming fantasies – but now they wish to experience those larger-than-life battles in magnificent high definition, with all of the amazing special effects, vehicle physics and gameplay intensity that the next-generation has to offer.

Star Wars Battlefront, developed by DICE on Frostbite 3, will surprise and delight fans yet again with a new experience inside this beloved universe made with our signature DICE craftsmanship and commitment to excellence.
description_for_label:

Star Wars Battlefront, developed by DICE on Frostbite 3, will surprise and delight fans yet again with a new experience inside this beloved universe made with our signature DICE craftsmanship and commitment to excellence.

results.title: Walkabout
results.creator_credit: Nicolas Roeg, Si Litvinoff and Max L. Raab - Si Litvinoff Films
results.brief_description: Nicolas Roeg’s lyrical tale about a sister and her young brother left stranded in the Australian outback having survived their father’s attempt to destroy the family. They’re rescued by a young Aboriginal man (David Gulpilil) who has journeyed into the vast desert on his walkabout - a tribal initiation into manhood.

constellations_other.name: David Gulpilil
constellations_other.description: David Gulpilil is a Yolngu man of the Mandhalpuyngu speech of the Djinba language. As a young boy, Gulpilil was an accomplished hunter, tracker and dancer, which he turned into an acclaimed film career that saw him win the Best Actor award at the Cannes Film Festival (for Charlie's Country) and an AACTA for The Tracker, among his many honours.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Nicolas Roeg, Si Litvinoff and Max L. Raab - Si Litvinoff Films
results.description: Nicolas Roeg’s lyrical tale about a sister (Jenny Agutter) and her young brother (Lucien John) left stranded in the Australian outback having survived their father’s attempt to destroy the family. They are rescued by a young Aboriginal man (David Gulpilil) who has journeyed into the vast desert on his walkabout - a tribal initiation into manhood. During their journey Gulpilil courts the young woman, though in her incomprehension she rejects his advances. The vision of paradise lost presented with an often surreal intensity is that of a European outsider, who sees white history as invasive and deeply destructive. Also stars John Meillon, Robert McDara, Pete Carver, John Illingsworth, Hilary Bamberger, Barry Donnelly, Noelene Brown and Carlo Machini. Screenplay by Edward Bond, based on the novel by James Vance Marshall. Edited by Antony Gibbs and Alan Pattillo. Music composed and conducted by John Barry.

results.title: Only the Brave
results.creator_credit: Ana Kokkinos, Fiona Eagger and Pickpocket Productions
results.brief_description: Alex (Elena Mandalis) and Vicki (Dora Kaskanis) are two young Greek Australian girls in Melbourne’s western suburbs. Only together - committing arson, hanging out - do they find moments of peace in their lives.

constellations_other.name: Ana Kokkinos
constellations_other.description: The films and TV works of Ana Kokkinos often explore the experiences of second-generation Australians, queer identities and class. Since beginning her career in the early 90s, those stories have started to appear more frequently on Australian screens.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Ana Kokkinos, Fiona Eagger and Pickpocket Productions
results.description: Alex (Elena Mandalis) and Vicki (Dora Kaskanis) are two young Greek Australian girls in Melbourne’s western suburbs. Vicki is bored with school and she is abused by her father at home. Alex misses her estranged mother and is trying to deal with her growing sexual attraction to a female teacher (well played by Maude Davey). Only together - committing arson, hanging out - do they find moments of peace in their lives. This tough short film is an outstanding example of a recent Australian cinema. Weaving themes of sexuality, ethnicity and dislocation, “Only the Brave” manages to be realist and elegiac, sensitive and uncompromising, and show how the impact of migration has altered the tradition, landscape and narratives of Australian culture. Mandalis and Kaskanis are knock-outs in their first screen performances and the the film received an AFI Award for best short film and the Audience Award at the Sundance Film Festival. Written by Ana Kokkinos and Mira Robertson.
description_for_label: Alex (Elena Mandalis) and Vicki (Dora Kaskanis) are two young Greek Australian girls in Melbourne’s western suburbs. results.title: South Park: The Stick of Truth
results.brief_description: From the perilous battlefields of the fourth-grade playground, a young hero will rise, destined to be South Park’s savior.

constellations_other.name: Bell & Howell Projector 621: This picture has been edited for content
constellations_other.description: The Bell & Howell-Gaumont Model 621 projector was originally used entertain the shearers on a sheep farm in South Australia with the films screened sometimes edited for distribution.

results.description:
From the perilous battlefields of the fourth-grade playground, a young hero will rise, destined to be South Park’s savior. From the creators of South Park, Trey Parker and Matt Stone, comes an epic quest to become… cool. Introducing South Park™: The Stick of Truth™.You begin as the new kid in town facing a harrowing challenge: making friends.

As you start your quest the children of South Park are embroiled in a city-wide, live-action-role-playing game, casting imaginary spells and swinging fake swords. Over time the simple children’s game escalates into a battle of good and evil that threatens to consume the world.Arm yourself with weapons of legend to defeat crab people, underpants gnomes, hippies and other forces of evil.

Discover the lost Stick of Truth and earn your place at the side of Stan, Kyle, Cartman and Kenny as their new friend. Succeed, and you shall be South Park’s savior, cementing your social status in South Park Elementary. Fail, and you will forever be known… as a loser.
description_for_label:
From the perilous battlefields of the fourth-grade playground, a young hero will rise, destined to be South Park’s savior. From the creators of South Park, Trey Parker and Matt Stone, comes an epic quest to become… cool. results.brief_description: Troubled Italian filmmaker Guido Anselmi (Marcello Mastroianni) struggles with creative stasis as he attempts to get a new movie off the ground.

constellations_other.name: Making films in black and white
constellations_other.description: Oscar-winner Sandy Powell crafted Abigail's (Emma Stone) costume in The Favourite to represent her ascension in the royal household of Queen Anne by utilising black and white.

results.description: After the international success of “La Dolce Vita” Fellini found himself in the position of an “overnight sensation”, with critics, audiences and cinema producers expecting his next film to be even more of a success. His predicament caused him to experience a self-doubting of his intellect and creativity, a self-doubt that he managed to commit to screen in this wonderful film. For “8 1/2” is about the struggle to create cinema; about the financial, creative, physical and mental exertions needed to produce a film. Marcello Mastroianni plays a film director, Guido Anselmi, who is beset by adoring fans, angry mistresses, nervous financial backers and hostile critics while in the process of directing his current film. Mixing autobiography, fantastical dream sequences, imaginative sets and starkly photographed childhood memories, “8 1/2” is the most entertaining and stimulating film ever made about film-making. Cast includes Claudia Cardinale, Anouk Aimee and Barbara Steele. Music score by Nino Rota. Voted second best film ever made by a “Sight and Sound” international poll in 1992.

results.title: The Truman show
results.creator_credit: Peter Weir, Adam Schroeder, Edward S. Feldman, Andrew Niccol, Scott Rudin and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Truman Burbank (Jim Carrey) is the star of a television experiment: he does not know that since birth his life has been the centre of a television show called The Truman Show.

constellations_other.name: Fake news: too little too late
constellations_other.description: Unbound Creations’ Headliner: NoviNews explores the impact of the media and fake news on society, something that is fast becoming one of the biggest concerns of our age.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Weir, Adam Schroeder, Edward S. Feldman, Andrew Niccol, Scott Rudin and Paramount Pictures
results.description: Truman Burbank (Jim Carrey) is the star of a television experiment: he does not know that since birth his life has been the centre of a television show called The Truman Show. The world he lives in is one giant TV set and his family, his marriage and his work are all shams. Gradually, however, Truman comes to suspect that there is something not quite right with his life. As Truman attempts to discover the truth behind the banality of his existence, his attempts are frustrated by the control and power of the man (Ed Harris) who has created “his” life; and by the expectations of a TV audience who have themselves grown up on The Truman Show. From this fantastical premise, Peter Weir has created a moving fable about our obsession with media and the destructive potential of such obsession. Truman exists in a world where reality is meaningless but the film posits that the audiences who watch his life unfold on television are themselves blind to the distinction between media and the real. Weir has crafted a morality tale which utilises the best of contemporary studio craft to present a tale with the simple force and grace of a modern fairy tale.
description_for_label: Truman Burbank (Jim Carrey) is the star of a television experiment: he does not know that since birth his life has been the centre of a television show called The Truman Show. From this fantastical premise, Peter Weir has created a moving fable about our obsession with media and the destructive potential of such obsession. results.title: Beneath Clouds
results.creator_credit: Ivan Sen, Teresa-Jayne Hanlon, AFFC, Australian Film Commission, New South Wales Film and Television Office, SBS Independent and Autumn Films
results.brief_description: Ivan Sen’s debut feature continues the story of one of his acclaimed short films, ‘Tears’. Two disaffected teenagers, Vaughn and Lena (played by non-professional actors Damian Pitt and Dannielle Hall), meet on the road as they flee their troubled backgrounds and head to the city.

constellations_other.name: Setting the record straight
constellations_other.description: For too long, the history of Australia was only told in mainstream films through a white lens. First Nations people have used the camera as a means of truth-telling and setting the record straight for decades.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Ivan Sen, Teresa-Jayne Hanlon, AFFC, Australian Film Commission, New South Wales Film and Television Office, SBS Independent and Autumn Films
results.description:
Ivan Sen’s debut feature continues the story of one of his acclaimed short films, ‘Tears’. Two disaffected teenagers, Vaughn and Lena (played by non-professional actors Damian Pitt and Dannielle Hall), meet on the road as they flee their troubled backgrounds and head to the city. Lena, a light-skinned Aboriginal who passes as white, is looking for the Irish father she only knows from photographs. Vaughn is on the run from a prison farm, going home to see his dying mother who long ago gave him up. He is angry and prone to violent outbursts, especially against white people. Though uncommunicative and wary of each other, the two develop an uneasy, tentative bond as their journey progresses and they encounter various Indigenous and European Australians. With extremely sparse dialogue and little character development, Sen uses visual language to convey the emotional isolation of the pair who are often framed in long shot against the open vistas of the Northern New South Wales rural landscape (shot around Moree), or in extreme close-ups. The chasm between black and white Australia and a continuing history of brutality against Indigenous Australians are underlying themes that run through the film.

Written by Ivan Sen; photography, Allan Collins; music, Alister Spence and Ivan Sen; editing, Karen Johnson.
description_for_label:

Two disaffected teenagers, Vaughn and Lena (played by non-professional actors Damian Pitt and Dannielle Hall), meet on the road as they flee their troubled backgrounds and head to the city. Vaughn is on the run from a prison farm, going home to see his dying mother who long ago gave him up. He is angry and prone to violent outbursts, especially against white people. Though uncommunicative and wary of each other, the two develop an uneasy, tentative bond as their journey progresses and they encounter various Indigenous and European Australians.
